name: Enigma Force
description:
Following the events depicted in Shadowfire, General Zoff, the republican dictator, has been captured, but he still had time to declare war on the empire. While five members of the Enigma team: Zark, Sevrina, Syylk, Maul and yourself; escort Zoff to face the Emperor’s wrath, the war flares across the galaxy. As you cross the imperial border, Zoff concentrates his awesome psionic powers on the Enigma craft’s guidance system. Moments later the ship is bucking and burning through the atmosphere of a planet. You awake, head throbbing, to find the Enigma craft wrecked and General Zoff missing …

Gameplay is very similar to its predecessor Shadowfire. Take control of your four Enigma Force members, each with different abilities, and lead them through an underground complex filled with enemy soldiers and lots of puzzles. You will often need to combine the abilities of more the one crew member to solve a single puzzle.

The user interface is completely icon-driven. Only character movement and shooting is done directly with joystick. The game is in real time and you often need to switch between the characters because the enemy troops also move to through the complex and attack.

shot.caption: This screen displays as the game loads
This is the main game screen, currently showing the controller selection options
The game starts with a set of information screens. The ship is about to crash into a planet, Zoff has escaped in a lifepod. Everyone could be about to die and all Imperial Command care about is Zoff
The game starts here on the planet surface. Commands are issued by selecting a character and then by selecting an action. The green bar represents the health / strength of the selected character
Here MAUL, the combat weapons droid has been selected. The colour of his icon changes from green and flashes between yellow & red
Now the 'Move Down' action has been selected. Unfortunately Maul's path is blocked by other characters so the next action must be to move one of them out of the way
Selecting Zark Montor the team leader.
Zark automatically walks to the right and opens any doors that are in the way. Here he is in his new location which means .....
... back on screen 1 Maul has been able to move down. Here the blue icon for Sevrina Maris, 'Mistress of mayhem', the second in command, has been selected to follow it
Sevrina and Maul in their new location
Back at location 1 to issue an order to the last member of the party, Syylk, second in command. A message is received but who's being attacked!!?
The 'Move Down' command is issued to Syylk. He joins the rest of the party that is under attack. Combat is automatic, there's no need to target the baddies
Time to bring in reinforcements. This screen shows that team members can be separated but all are notified whenever there's a fight
Zark joins the others and soon the battle ends
The yellow TV screen icon brings up the current game stats
Moving the cursor to the right / left scrolls the command list sideways. It is possible to stack 5 commands on the Spectrum. The OOPS command is used when a stacking error is made
